page.title: 08FARMING IN FRILSHAM (2)
page.content: Milk production is the main source of income such as those in this area.It has been rising in recent years. In response to pressure from the{European {Economic Community}the Government has imposed{quotas}on farmers- 10% less than the year before. There is a total quota on the whole country with a complicated system of assessment and computation. A farmer is fined 17 pence for every excess litre of milk. The small farmers' lobby is very strong in the European Community. In Britain family farmers like those in Frilsham are at risk.{Cereal prices} have been dropping owing to bumper harvests in 1983-84 with large grain mountains building up and a consequent fall in prices for the farmer. This grain and milk could feed starving people in Africa and elsewhere.
